explanation: The report is correct. MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.2 (clause 4) requires that the single loop counter of a for statement shall not be modified in the loop body. In the code the loop counter is i (for (i = 1; i < argc; ++i)). Inside the body there is an explicit modification of the loop counter: if (PERF_RPL_PARAM_STR_PLUS_NEXT == param_res) ++i; — this updates the loop counter from within the loop body and therefore violates Rule 14.2. (Even if the decision to perform the increment is based on the result of a function call, that does not avoid the violation.)
